00028 /*
00029  * lustre/lod/lod_lov.c
00030  *
00031  * A set of helpers to maintain Logical Object Volume (LOV)
00032  * Extended Attribute (EA) and known OST targets
00033  *
00034  * Author: Alex Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>
00035  */
00036 
00037 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_MDS
00038 
00039 #include <obd_class.h>
00040 #include <lustre_lfsck.h>
00041 #include <lustre_lmv.h>
00042 #include <lustre_swab.h>
00043 
00044 #include "lod_internal.h"
00045 
00055 void lod_getref(struct lod_tgt_descs *ltd)
00056 {
00057         down_read(&ltd->ltd_rw_sem);
00058         mutex_lock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00059         ltd->ltd_refcount++;
00060         mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00061 }
00062 
00073 void lod_putref(struct lod_device *lod, struct lod_tgt_descs *ltd)
00074 {
00075         mutex_lock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00076         ltd->ltd_refcount--;
00077         if (ltd->ltd_refcount == 0 && ltd->ltd_death_row) {
00078                 struct lod_tgt_desc *tgt_desc, *tmp;
00079                 struct list_head kill;
00080                 unsigned int idx;
00081 
00082                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "destroying %d ltd desc\n",
00083                        ltd->ltd_death_row);
00084 
00085                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kill);
00086 
00087                 cfs_foreach_bit(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, idx) {
00088                         tgt_desc = LTD_TGT(ltd, idx);
00089                         LASSERT(tgt_desc);
00090 
00091                         if (!tgt_desc->ltd_reap)
00092                                 continue;
00093 
00094                         list_add(&tgt_desc->ltd_kill, &kill);
00095                         LTD_TGT(ltd, idx) = NULL;
00096                         /*FIXME: only support ost pool for now */
00097                         if (ltd == &lod->lod_ost_descs) {
00098                                 lod_ost_pool_remove(&lod->lod_pool_info, idx);
00099                                 if (tgt_desc->ltd_active)
00100                                         lod->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count--;
00101                         }
00102                         ltd->ltd_tgtnr--;
00103                         cfs_bitmap_clear(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, idx);
00104                         ltd->ltd_death_row--;
00105                 }
00106                 mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00107                 up_read(&ltd->ltd_rw_sem);
00108 
00109                 list_for_each_entry_safe(tgt_desc, tmp, &kill, ltd_kill) {
00110                         int rc;
00111                         list_del(&tgt_desc->ltd_kill);
00112                         if (ltd == &lod->lod_ost_descs) {
00113                                 /* remove from QoS structures */
00114                                 rc = qos_del_tgt(lod, tgt_desc);
00115                                 if (rc)
00116                                         CERROR("%s: qos_del_tgt(%s) failed:"
00117                                                "rc = %d\n",
00118                                                lod2obd(lod)->obd_name,
00119                                               obd_uuid2str(&tgt_desc->ltd_uuid),
00120                                                rc);
00121                         }
00122                         rc = obd_disconnect(tgt_desc->ltd_exp);
00123                         if (rc)
00124                                 CERROR("%s: failed to disconnect %s: rc = %d\n",
00125                                        lod2obd(lod)->obd_name,
00126                                        obd_uuid2str(&tgt_desc->ltd_uuid), rc);
00127                         OBD_FREE_PTR(tgt_desc);
00128                 }
00129         } else {
00130                 mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00131                 up_read(&ltd->ltd_rw_sem);
00132         }
00133 }
00134 
00149 static int ltd_bitmap_resize(struct lod_tgt_descs *ltd, __u32 newsize)
00150 {
00151         struct cfs_bitmap *new_bitmap, *old_bitmap = NULL;
00152         int           rc = 0;
00153         ENTRY;
00154 
00155         /* grab write reference on the lod. Relocating the array requires
00156          * exclusive access */
00157 
00158         down_write(&ltd->ltd_rw_sem);
00159         if (newsize <= ltd->ltd_tgts_size)
00160                 /* someone else has already resize the array */
00161                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00162 
00163         /* allocate new bitmap */
00164         new_bitmap = CFS_ALLOCATE_BITMAP(newsize);
00165         if (!new_bitmap)
00166                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00167 
00168         if (ltd->ltd_tgts_size > 0) {
00169                 /* the bitmap already exists, we need
00170                  * to copy data from old one */
00171                 cfs_bitmap_copy(new_bitmap, ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap);
00172                 old_bitmap = ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap;
00173         }
00174 
00175         ltd->ltd_tgts_size  = newsize;
00176         ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap = new_bitmap;
00177 
00178         if (old_bitmap)
00179                 CFS_FREE_BITMAP(old_bitmap);
00180 
00181         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "tgt size: %d\n", ltd->ltd_tgts_size);
00182 
00183         EXIT;
00184 out:
00185         up_write(&ltd->ltd_rw_sem);
00186         return rc;
00187 }
00188 
00207 int lod_add_device(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_device *lod,
00208                    char *osp, unsigned index, unsigned gen, int tgt_index,
00209                    char *type, int active)
00210 {
00211         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00212         struct obd_export       *exp = NULL;
00213         struct obd_device       *obd;
00214         struct lu_device        *lu_dev;
00215         struct dt_device        *dt_dev;
00216         int                      rc;
00217         struct lod_tgt_desc     *tgt_desc;
00218         struct lod_tgt_descs    *ltd;
00219         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
00220         struct obd_uuid         obd_uuid;
00221         bool                    for_ost;
00222         bool lock = false;
00223         ENTRY;
00224 
00225         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "osp:%s idx:%d gen:%d\n", osp, index, gen);
00226 
00227         if (gen <= 0) {
00228                 CERROR("request to add OBD %s with invalid generation: %d\n",
00229                        osp, gen);
00230                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00231         }
00232 
00233         obd_str2uuid(&obd_uuid, osp);
00234 
00235         obd = class_find_client_obd(&obd_uuid, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME,
00236                                 &lod->lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_uuid);
00237         if (obd == NULL) {
00238                 CERROR("can't find %s device\n", osp);
00239                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00240         }
00241 
00242         LASSERT(obd->obd_lu_dev != NULL);
00243         LASSERT(obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site == lod->lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site);
00244 
00245         lu_dev = obd->obd_lu_dev;
00246         dt_dev = lu2dt_dev(lu_dev);
00247 
00248         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00249         if (data == NULL)
00250                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc = -ENOMEM);
00251 
00252         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_INDEX | OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
00253         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00254         data->ocd_index = index;
00255 
00256         if (strcmp(LUSTRE_OSC_NAME, type) == 0) {
00257                 for_ost = true;
00258                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_AT |
00259                                            OBD_CONNECT_FULL20 |
00260                                            OBD_CONNECT_INDEX |
00261 #ifdef HAVE_LRU_RESIZE_SUPPORT
00262                                            OBD_CONNECT_LRU_RESIZE |
00263 #endif
00264                                            OBD_CONNECT_MDS |
00265                                            OBD_CONNECT_REQPORTAL |
00266                                            OBD_CONNECT_SKIP_ORPHAN |
00267                                            OBD_CONNECT_FID |
00268                                            OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE |
00269                                            OBD_CONNECT_VERSION |
00270                                            OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS |
00271                                            OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK |
00272                                            OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS;
00273 
00274                 data->ocd_group = tgt_index;
00275                 ltd = &lod->lod_ost_descs;
00276         } else {
00277                 struct obd_import *imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00278 
00279                 for_ost = false;
00280                 data->ocd_ibits_known = MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE;
00281                 data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_ACL |
00282                                            OBD_CONNECT_IBITS |
00283                                            OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS |
00284                                            OBD_CONNECT_FID |
00285                                            OBD_CONNECT_AT |
00286                                            OBD_CONNECT_FULL20 |
00287                                            OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK |
00288                                            OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS;
00289                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00290                 imp->imp_server_timeout = 1;
00291                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00292                 imp->imp_client->cli_request_portal = OUT_PORTAL;
00293                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: Set 'mds' portal and timeout\n",
00294                       obd->obd_name);
00295                 ltd = &lod->lod_mdt_descs;
00296         }
00297 
00298         rc = obd_connect(env, &exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid, data, NULL);
00299         OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00300         if (rc) {
00301                 CERROR("%s: cannot connect to next dev %s (%d)\n",
00302                        obd->obd_name, osp, rc);
00303                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00304         }
00305 
00306         /* Allocate ost descriptor and fill it */
00307         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(tgt_desc);
00308         if (!tgt_desc)
00309                 GOTO(out_conn, rc = -ENOMEM);
00310 
00311         tgt_desc->ltd_tgt    = dt_dev;
00312         tgt_desc->ltd_exp    = exp;
00313         tgt_desc->ltd_uuid   = obd->u.cli.cl_target_uuid;
00314         tgt_desc->ltd_gen    = gen;
00315         tgt_desc->ltd_index  = index;
00316         tgt_desc->ltd_active = active;
00317 
00318         lod_getref(ltd);
00319         if (index >= ltd->ltd_tgts_size) {
00320                 /* we have to increase the size of the lod_osts array */
00321                 __u32  newsize;
00322 
00323                 newsize = max(ltd->ltd_tgts_size, (__u32)2);
00324                 while (newsize < index + 1)
00325                         newsize = newsize << 1;
00326 
00327                 /* lod_bitmap_resize() needs lod_rw_sem
00328                  * which we hold with th reference */
00329                 lod_putref(lod, ltd);
00330 
00331                 rc = ltd_bitmap_resize(ltd, newsize);
00332                 if (rc)
00333                         GOTO(out_desc, rc);
00334 
00335                 lod_getref(ltd);
00336         }
00337 
00338         mutex_lock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00339         lock = true;
00340         if (cfs_bitmap_check(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, index)) {
00341                 CERROR("%s: device %d is registered already\n", obd->obd_name,
00342                        index);
00343                 GOTO(out_mutex, rc = -EEXIST);
00344         }
00345 
00346         if (ltd->ltd_tgt_idx[index / TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK] == NULL) {
00347                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ltd->ltd_tgt_idx[index / TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK]);
00348                 if (ltd->ltd_tgt_idx[index / TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK] == NULL) {
00349                         CERROR("can't allocate index to add %s\n",
00350                                obd->obd_name);
00351                         GOTO(out_mutex, rc = -ENOMEM);
00352                 }
00353         }
00354 
00355         if (for_ost) {
00356                 /* pool and qos are not supported for MDS stack yet */
00357                 rc = lod_ost_pool_add(&lod->lod_pool_info, index,
00358                                       lod->lod_osts_size);
00359                 if (rc) {
00360                         CERROR("%s: can't set up pool, failed with %d\n",
00361                                obd->obd_name, rc);
00362                         GOTO(out_mutex, rc);
00363                 }
00364 
00365                 rc = qos_add_tgt(lod, tgt_desc);
00366                 if (rc) {
00367                         CERROR("%s: qos_add_tgt failed with %d\n",
00368                                 obd->obd_name, rc);
00369                         GOTO(out_pool, rc);
00370                 }
00371 
00372                 /* The new OST is now a full citizen */
00373                 if (index >= lod->lod_desc.ld_tgt_count)
00374                         lod->lod_desc.ld_tgt_count = index + 1;
00375                 if (active)
00376                         lod->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count++;
00377         }
00378 
00379         LTD_TGT(ltd, index) = tgt_desc;
00380         cfs_bitmap_set(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, index);
00381         ltd->ltd_tgtnr++;
00382         mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00383         lod_putref(lod, ltd);
00384         lock = false;
00385         if (lod->lod_recovery_completed)
00386                 lu_dev->ld_ops->ldo_recovery_complete(env, lu_dev);
00387 
00388         if (!for_ost && lod->lod_initialized) {
00389                 rc = lod_sub_init_llog(env, lod, tgt_desc->ltd_tgt);
00390                 if (rc != 0) {
00391                         CERROR("%s: cannot start llog on %s:rc = %d\n",
00392                                lod2obd(lod)->obd_name, osp, rc);
00393                         GOTO(out_ltd, rc);
00394                 }
00395         }
00396 
00397         rc = lfsck_add_target(env, lod->lod_child, dt_dev, exp, index, for_ost);
00398         if (rc != 0) {
00399                 CERROR("Fail to add LFSCK target: name = %s, type = %s, "
00400                        "index = %u, rc = %d\n", osp, type, index, rc);
00401                 GOTO(out_fini_llog, rc);
00402         }
00403         RETURN(rc);
00404 out_fini_llog:
00405         lod_sub_fini_llog(env, tgt_desc->ltd_tgt,
00406                           tgt_desc->ltd_recovery_thread);
00407 out_ltd:
00408         lod_getref(ltd);
00409         mutex_lock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00410         lock = true;
00411         if (!for_ost && LTD_TGT(ltd, index)->ltd_recovery_thread != NULL) {
00412                 struct ptlrpc_thread *thread;
00413 
00414                 thread = LTD_TGT(ltd, index)->ltd_recovery_thread;
00415                 OBD_FREE_PTR(thread);
00416         }
00417         ltd->ltd_tgtnr--;
00418         cfs_bitmap_clear(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, index);
00419         LTD_TGT(ltd, index) = NULL;
00420 out_pool:
00421         lod_ost_pool_remove(&lod->lod_pool_info, index);
00422 out_mutex:
00423         if (lock) {
00424                 mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00425                 lod_putref(lod, ltd);
00426         }
00427 out_desc:
00428         OBD_FREE_PTR(tgt_desc);
00429 out_conn:
00430         obd_disconnect(exp);
00431 out_cleanup:
00432         /* XXX OSP needs us to send down LCFG_CLEANUP because it uses
00433          * objects from the MDT stack. See LU-7184. */
00434         lcfg = &lod_env_info(env)->lti_lustre_cfg;
00435         memset(lcfg, 0, sizeof(*lcfg));
00436         lcfg->lcfg_version = LUSTRE_CFG_VERSION;
00437         lcfg->lcfg_command = LCFG_CLEANUP;
00438         lu_dev->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, lu_dev, lcfg);
00439 
00440         return rc;
00441 }
00442 
00456 static void __lod_del_device(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_device *lod,
00457                              struct lod_tgt_descs *ltd, unsigned idx,
00458                              bool for_ost)
00459 {
00460         LASSERT(LTD_TGT(ltd, idx));
00461 
00462         lfsck_del_target(env, lod->lod_child, LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)->ltd_tgt,
00463                          idx, for_ost);
00464 
00465         if (!for_ost && LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)->ltd_recovery_thread != NULL) {
00466                 struct ptlrpc_thread *thread;
00467 
00468                 thread = LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)->ltd_recovery_thread;
00469                 OBD_FREE_PTR(thread);
00470         }
00471 
00472         if (LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)->ltd_reap == 0) {
00473                 LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)->ltd_reap = 1;
00474                 ltd->ltd_death_row++;
00475         }
00476 }
00477 
00490 int lod_fini_tgt(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_device *lod,
00491                  struct lod_tgt_descs *ltd, bool for_ost)
00492 {
00493         unsigned int idx;
00494 
00495         if (ltd->ltd_tgts_size <= 0)
00496                 return 0;
00497         lod_getref(ltd);
00498         mutex_lock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00499         cfs_foreach_bit(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, idx)
00500                 __lod_del_device(env, lod, ltd, idx, for_ost);
00501         mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00502         lod_putref(lod, ltd);
00503         CFS_FREE_BITMAP(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap);
00504         for (idx = 0; idx < TGT_PTRS; idx++) {
00505                 if (ltd->ltd_tgt_idx[idx])
00506                         OBD_FREE_PTR(ltd->ltd_tgt_idx[idx]);
00507         }
00508         ltd->ltd_tgts_size = 0;
00509         return 0;
00510 }
00511 
00529 int lod_del_device(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_device *lod,
00530                    struct lod_tgt_descs *ltd, char *osp, unsigned idx,
00531                    unsigned gen, bool for_ost)
00532 {
00533         struct obd_device *obd;
00534         int                rc = 0;
00535         struct obd_uuid    uuid;
00536         ENTRY;
00537 
00538         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "osp:%s idx:%d gen:%d\n", osp, idx, gen);
00539 
00540         obd_str2uuid(&uuid, osp);
00541 
00542         obd = class_find_client_obd(&uuid, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME,
00543                                    &lod->lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_uuid);
00544         if (obd == NULL) {
00545                 CERROR("can't find %s device\n", osp);
00546                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00547         }
00548 
00549         if (gen <= 0) {
00550                 CERROR("%s: request to remove OBD %s with invalid generation %d"
00551                        "\n", obd->obd_name, osp, gen);
00552                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00553         }
00554 
00555         obd_str2uuid(&uuid,  osp);
00556 
00557         lod_getref(ltd);
00558         mutex_lock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00559         /* check that the index is allocated in the bitmap */
00560         if (!cfs_bitmap_check(ltd->ltd_tgt_bitmap, idx) ||
00561             !LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)) {
00562                 CERROR("%s: device %d is not set up\n", obd->obd_name, idx);
00563                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00564         }
00565 
00566         /* check that the UUID matches */
00567         if (!obd_uuid_equals(&uuid, &LTD_TGT(ltd, idx)->ltd_uuid)) {
00568                 CERROR("%s: LOD target UUID %s at index %d does not match %s\n",
00569                        obd->obd_name, obd_uuid2str(&LTD_TGT(ltd,idx)->ltd_uuid),
00570                        idx, osp);
00571                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00572         }
00573 
00574         __lod_del_device(env, lod, ltd, idx, for_ost);
00575         EXIT;
00576 out:
00577         mutex_unlock(&ltd->ltd_mutex);
00578         lod_putref(lod, ltd);
00579         return(rc);
00580 }
00581 
00596 int lod_ea_store_resize(struct lod_thread_info *info, size_t size)
00597 {
00598         __u32 round = size_roundup_power2(size);
00599 
00600         LASSERT(round <=
00601                 lov_mds_md_size(LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT, LOV_MAGIC_V3));
00602         if (info->lti_ea_store) {
00603                 LASSERT(info->lti_ea_store_size);
00604                 LASSERT(info->lti_ea_store_size < round);
00605                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "EA store size %d is not enough, need %d\n",
00606                        info->lti_ea_store_size, round);
00607                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(info->lti_ea_store, info->lti_ea_store_size);
00608                 info->lti_ea_store = NULL;
00609                 info->lti_ea_store_size = 0;
00610         }
00611 
00612         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(info->lti_ea_store, round);
00613         if (info->lti_ea_store == NULL)
00614                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00615         info->lti_ea_store_size = round;
00616 
00617         RETURN(0);
00618 }
00619 
00636 int lod_generate_and_set_lovea(const struct lu_env *env,
00637                                struct lod_object *lo, struct thandle *th)
00638 {
00639         struct lod_thread_info  *info = lod_env_info(env);
00640         struct dt_object        *next = dt_object_child(&lo->ldo_obj);
00641         const struct lu_fid     *fid  = lu_object_fid(&lo->ldo_obj.do_lu);
00642         struct lov_mds_md_v1    *lmm;
00643         struct lov_ost_data_v1  *objs;
00644         __u32                    magic;
00645         int                      i, rc;
00646         size_t                   lmm_size;
00647         ENTRY;
00648 
00649         LASSERT(lo);
00650 
00651         magic = lo->ldo_pool != NULL ? LOV_MAGIC_V3 : LOV_MAGIC_V1;
00652         lmm_size = lov_mds_md_size(lo->ldo_stripenr, magic);
00653         if (info->lti_ea_store_size < lmm_size) {
00654                 rc = lod_ea_store_resize(info, lmm_size);
00655                 if (rc)
00656                         RETURN(rc);
00657         }
00658 
00659         if (lo->ldo_pattern == 0) /* default striping */
00660                 lo->ldo_pattern = LOV_PATTERN_RAID0;
00661 
00662         lmm = info->lti_ea_store;
00663 
00664         lmm->lmm_magic = cpu_to_le32(magic);
00665         lmm->lmm_pattern = cpu_to_le32(lo->ldo_pattern);
00666         fid_to_lmm_oi(fid, &lmm->lmm_oi);
00667         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_BAD_LMMOI))
00668                 lmm->lmm_oi.oi.oi_id++;
00669         lmm_oi_cpu_to_le(&lmm->lmm_oi, &lmm->lmm_oi);
00670         lmm->lmm_stripe_size = cpu_to_le32(lo->ldo_stripe_size);
00671         lmm->lmm_stripe_count = cpu_to_le16(lo->ldo_stripenr);
00672         if (lo->ldo_pattern & LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED)
00673                 lmm->lmm_stripe_count = cpu_to_le16(lo->ldo_released_stripenr);
00674         lmm->lmm_layout_gen = 0;
00675         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1) {
00676                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[0];
00677         } else {
00678                 struct lov_mds_md_v3 *v3 = (struct lov_mds_md_v3 *) lmm;
00679                 size_t cplen = strlcpy(v3->lmm_pool_name, lo->ldo_pool,
00680                                 sizeof(v3->lmm_pool_name));
00681                 if (cplen >= sizeof(v3->lmm_pool_name))
00682                         RETURN(-E2BIG);
00683                 objs = &v3->lmm_objects[0];
00684         }
00685 
00686         for (i = 0; i < lo->ldo_stripenr; i++) {
00687                 struct lu_fid           *fid    = &info->lti_fid;
00688                 struct lod_device       *lod;
00689                 __u32                   index;
00690                 int                     type    = LU_SEQ_RANGE_OST;
00691 
00692                 lod = lu2lod_dev(lo->ldo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
00693                 LASSERT(lo->ldo_stripe[i]);
00694 
00695                 *fid = *lu_object_fid(&lo->ldo_stripe[i]->do_lu);
00696                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_MULTIPLE_REF)) {
00697                         if (cfs_fail_val == 0)
00698                                 cfs_fail_val = fid->f_oid;
00699                         else
00700                                 fid->f_oid = cfs_fail_val;
00701                 }
00702 
00703                 rc = fid_to_ostid(fid, &info->lti_ostid);
00704                 LASSERT(rc == 0);
00705 
00706                 ostid_cpu_to_le(&info->lti_ostid, &objs[i].l_ost_oi);
00707                 objs[i].l_ost_gen    = cpu_to_le32(0);
00708                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_FLD_LOOKUP))
00709                         rc = -ENOENT;
00710                 else
00711                         rc = lod_fld_lookup(env, lod, fid,
00712                                             &index, &type);
00713                 if (rc < 0) {
00714                         CERROR("%s: Can not locate "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00715                                lod2obd(lod)->obd_name, PFID(fid), rc);
00716                         lod_object_free_striping(env, lo);
00717                         RETURN(rc);
00718                 }
00719                 objs[i].l_ost_idx = cpu_to_le32(index);
00720         }
00721 
00722         info->lti_buf.lb_buf = lmm;
00723         info->lti_buf.lb_len = lmm_size;
00724         rc = lod_sub_object_xattr_set(env, next, &info->lti_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
00725                                       0, th);
00726         if (rc < 0) {
00727                 lod_object_free_striping(env, lo);
00728                 RETURN(rc);
00729         }
00730 
00731         RETURN(rc);
00732 }
00733 
00748 int lod_get_ea(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
00749                const char *name)
00750 {
00751         struct lod_thread_info  *info = lod_env_info(env);
00752         struct dt_object        *next = dt_object_child(&lo->ldo_obj);
00753         int                     rc;
00754         ENTRY;
00755 
00756         LASSERT(info);
00757 
00758         if (unlikely(info->lti_ea_store == NULL)) {
00759                 /* just to enter in allocation block below */
00760                 rc = -ERANGE;
00761         } else {
00762 repeat:
00763                 info->lti_buf.lb_buf = info->lti_ea_store;
00764                 info->lti_buf.lb_len = info->lti_ea_store_size;
00765                 rc = dt_xattr_get(env, next, &info->lti_buf, name);
00766         }
00767 
00768         /* if object is not striped or inaccessible */
00769         if (rc == -ENODATA || rc == -ENOENT)
00770                 RETURN(0);
00771 
00772         if (rc == -ERANGE) {
00773                 /* EA doesn't fit, reallocate new buffer */
00774                 rc = dt_xattr_get(env, next, &LU_BUF_NULL, name);
00775                 if (rc == -ENODATA || rc == -ENOENT)
00776                         RETURN(0);
00777                 else if (rc < 0)
00778                         RETURN(rc);
00779 
00780                 LASSERT(rc > 0);
00781                 rc = lod_ea_store_resize(info, rc);
00782                 if (rc)
00783                         RETURN(rc);
00784                 goto repeat;
00785         }
00786 
00787         RETURN(rc);
00788 }
00789 
00799 static int validate_lod_and_idx(struct lod_device *md, __u32 idx)
00800 {
00801         if (unlikely(idx >= md->lod_ost_descs.ltd_tgts_size ||
00802                      !cfs_bitmap_check(md->lod_ost_bitmap, idx))) {
00803                 CERROR("%s: bad idx: %d of %d\n", lod2obd(md)->obd_name, idx,
00804                        md->lod_ost_descs.ltd_tgts_size);
00805                 return -EINVAL;
00806         }
00807 
00808         if (unlikely(OST_TGT(md, idx) == NULL)) {
00809                 CERROR("%s: bad lod_tgt_desc for idx: %d\n",
00810                        lod2obd(md)->obd_name, idx);
00811                 return -EINVAL;
00812         }
00813 
00814         if (unlikely(OST_TGT(md, idx)->ltd_ost == NULL)) {
00815                 CERROR("%s: invalid lod device, for idx: %d\n",
00816                        lod2obd(md)->obd_name , idx);
00817                 return -EINVAL;
00818         }
00819 
00820         return 0;
00821 }
00822 
00839 int lod_initialize_objects(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
00840                            struct lov_ost_data_v1 *objs)
00841 {
00842         struct lod_thread_info  *info = lod_env_info(env);
00843         struct lod_device       *md;
00844         struct lu_object        *o, *n;
00845         struct lu_device        *nd;
00846         struct dt_object       **stripe;
00847         int                      stripe_len;
00848         int                      i, rc = 0;
00849         __u32                   idx;
00850         ENTRY;
00851 
00852         LASSERT(lo != NULL);
00853         md = lu2lod_dev(lo->ldo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
00854         LASSERT(lo->ldo_stripe == NULL);
00855         LASSERT(lo->ldo_stripenr > 0);
00856         LASSERT(lo->ldo_stripe_size > 0);
00857 
00858         stripe_len = lo->ldo_stripenr;
00859         OBD_ALLOC(stripe, sizeof(stripe[0]) * stripe_len);
00860         if (stripe == NULL)
00861                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00862 
00863         for (i = 0; i < lo->ldo_stripenr; i++) {
00864                 if (unlikely(lovea_slot_is_dummy(&objs[i])))
00865                         continue;
00866 
00867                 ostid_le_to_cpu(&objs[i].l_ost_oi, &info->lti_ostid);
00868                 idx = le32_to_cpu(objs[i].l_ost_idx);
00869                 rc = ostid_to_fid(&info->lti_fid, &info->lti_ostid, idx);
00870                 if (rc != 0)
00871                         GOTO(out, rc);
00872                 LASSERTF(fid_is_sane(&info->lti_fid), ""DFID" insane!\n",
00873                          PFID(&info->lti_fid));
00874                 lod_getref(&md->lod_ost_descs);
00875 
00876                 rc = validate_lod_and_idx(md, idx);
00877                 if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
00878                         lod_putref(md, &md->lod_ost_descs);
00879                         GOTO(out, rc);
00880                 }
00881 
00882                 nd = &OST_TGT(md,idx)->ltd_ost->dd_lu_dev;
00883                 lod_putref(md, &md->lod_ost_descs);
00884 
00885                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
00886                  * u_obj_hop_keycmp() */
00887                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
00888                 o = lu_object_find_at(env, nd, &info->lti_fid, NULL);
00889                 if (IS_ERR(o))
00890                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(o));
00891 
00892                 n = lu_object_locate(o->lo_header, nd->ld_type);
00893                 LASSERT(n);
00894 
00895                 stripe[i] = container_of(n, struct dt_object, do_lu);
00896         }
00897 
00898 out:
00899         if (rc != 0) {
00900                 for (i = 0; i < stripe_len; i++)
00901                         if (stripe[i] != NULL)
00902                                 lu_object_put(env, &stripe[i]->do_lu);
00903 
00904                 OBD_FREE(stripe, sizeof(stripe[0]) * stripe_len);
00905                 lo->ldo_stripenr = 0;
00906         } else {
00907                 lo->ldo_stripe = stripe;
00908                 lo->ldo_stripes_allocated = stripe_len;
00909         }
00910 
00911         RETURN(rc);
00912 }
00913 
00927 int lod_parse_striping(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
00928                        const struct lu_buf *buf)
00929 {
00930         struct lov_mds_md_v1    *lmm;
00931         struct lov_ost_data_v1  *objs;
00932         __u32                    magic;
00933         __u32                    pattern;
00934         int                      rc = 0;
00935         ENTRY;
00936 
00937         LASSERT(buf);
00938         LASSERT(buf->lb_buf);
00939         LASSERT(buf->lb_len);
00940 
00941         lmm = (struct lov_mds_md_v1 *) buf->lb_buf;
00942         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
00943         pattern = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_pattern);
00944 
00945         if (magic != LOV_MAGIC_V1 && magic != LOV_MAGIC_V3)
00946                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00947         if (lov_pattern(pattern) != LOV_PATTERN_RAID0)
00948                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00949 
00950         lo->ldo_pattern = pattern;
00951         lo->ldo_stripe_size = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_size);
00952         lo->ldo_layout_gen = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_layout_gen);
00953         lo->ldo_stripenr = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count);
00954         /* released file stripenr fixup. */
00955         if (pattern & LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED)
00956                 lo->ldo_stripenr = 0;
00957 
00958         LASSERT(buf->lb_len >= lov_mds_md_size(lo->ldo_stripenr, magic));
00959 
00960         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3) {
00961                 struct lov_mds_md_v3 *v3 = (struct lov_mds_md_v3 *) lmm;
00962                 objs = &v3->lmm_objects[0];
00963                 lod_object_set_pool(lo, v3->lmm_pool_name);
00964         } else {
00965                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[0];
00966         }
00967 
00968         if (lo->ldo_stripenr > 0)
00969                 rc = lod_initialize_objects(env, lo, objs);
00970 
00971 out:
00972         RETURN(rc);
00973 }
00974 
00988 int lod_load_striping_locked(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo)
00989 {
00990         struct lod_thread_info  *info = lod_env_info(env);
00991         struct lu_buf           *buf  = &info->lti_buf;
00992         struct dt_object        *next = dt_object_child(&lo->ldo_obj);
00993         int                      rc = 0;
00994         ENTRY;
00995 
00996         /* already initialized? */
00997         if (lo->ldo_stripe != NULL)
00998                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00999 
01000         if (!dt_object_exists(next))
01001                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01002 
01003         /* Do not load stripe for slaves of striped dir */
01004         if (lo->ldo_dir_slave_stripe)
01005                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01006 
01007         if (S_ISREG(lu_object_attr(lod2lu_obj(lo)))) {
01008                 rc = lod_get_lov_ea(env, lo);
01009                 if (rc <= 0)
01010                         GOTO(out, rc);
01011                 /*
01012                  * there is LOV EA (striping information) in this object
01013                  * let's parse it and create in-core objects for the stripes
01014                  */
01015                 buf->lb_buf = info->lti_ea_store;
01016                 buf->lb_len = info->lti_ea_store_size;
01017                 rc = lod_parse_striping(env, lo, buf);
01018         } else if (S_ISDIR(lu_object_attr(lod2lu_obj(lo)))) {
01019                 rc = lod_get_lmv_ea(env, lo);
01020                 if (rc < (typeof(rc))sizeof(struct lmv_mds_md_v1))
01021                         GOTO(out, rc = rc > 0 ? -EINVAL : rc);
01022 
01023                 buf->lb_buf = info->lti_ea_store;
01024                 buf->lb_len = info->lti_ea_store_size;
01025                 if (rc == sizeof(struct lmv_mds_md_v1)) {
01026                         rc = lod_load_lmv_shards(env, lo, buf, true);
01027                         if (buf->lb_buf != info->lti_ea_store) {
01028                                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(info->lti_ea_store,
01029                                                info->lti_ea_store_size);
01030                                 info->lti_ea_store = buf->lb_buf;
01031                                 info->lti_ea_store_size = buf->lb_len;
01032                         }
01033 
01034                         if (rc < 0)
01035                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01036                 }
01037 
01038                 /*
01039                  * there is LOV EA (striping information) in this object
01040                  * let's parse it and create in-core objects for the stripes
01041                  */
01042                 rc = lod_parse_dir_striping(env, lo, buf);
01043         }
01044 
01045         if (rc == 0)
01046                 lo->ldo_striping_cached = 1;
01047 out:
01048         RETURN(rc);
01049 }
01050 
01067 int lod_load_striping(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo)
01068 {
01069         struct dt_object        *next = dt_object_child(&lo->ldo_obj);
01070         int                     rc = 0;
01071 
01072         /* currently this code is supposed to be called from declaration
01073          * phase only, thus the object is not expected to be locked by caller */
01074         dt_write_lock(env, next, 0);
01075         rc = lod_load_striping_locked(env, lo);
01076         dt_write_unlock(env, next);
01077         return rc;
01078 }
01079 
01097 int lod_verify_striping(struct lod_device *d, const struct lu_buf *buf,
01098                         bool is_from_disk)
01099 {
01100         struct lov_user_md_v1   *lum;
01101         struct lov_user_md_v3   *lum3;
01102         struct pool_desc        *pool = NULL;
01103         __u32                    magic;
01104         __u32                    stripe_size;
01105         __u16                    stripe_count;
01106         __u16                    stripe_offset;
01107         size_t                   lum_size;
01108         int                      rc = 0;
01109         ENTRY;
01110 
01111         lum = buf->lb_buf;
01112 
01113         LASSERT(sizeof(*lum) < sizeof(*lum3));
01114 
01115         if (buf->lb_len < sizeof(*lum)) {
01116                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "buf len %zu too small for lov_user_md\n",
01117                        buf->lb_len);
01118                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01119         }
01120 
01121         magic = le32_to_cpu(lum->lmm_magic);
01122         if (magic != LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1 &&
01123             magic != LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3 &&
01124             magic != LOV_MAGIC_V1_DEF &&
01125             magic != LOV_MAGIC_V3_DEF) {
01126                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "bad userland LOV MAGIC: %#x\n", magic);
01127                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01128         }
01129 
01130         /* the user uses "0" for default stripe pattern normally. */
01131         if (!is_from_disk && lum->lmm_pattern == 0)
01132                 lum->lmm_pattern = cpu_to_le32(LOV_PATTERN_RAID0);
01133 
01134         if (le32_to_cpu(lum->lmm_pattern) != LOV_PATTERN_RAID0) {
01135                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "bad userland stripe pattern: %#x\n",
01136                        le32_to_cpu(lum->lmm_pattern));
01137                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01138         }
01139 
01140         /* 64kB is the largest common page size we see (ia64), and matches the
01141          * check in lfs */
01142         stripe_size = le32_to_cpu(lum->lmm_stripe_size);
01143         if (stripe_size & (LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE - 1)) {
01144                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "stripe size %u not a multiple of %u\n",
01145                        stripe_size, LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE);
01146                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01147         }
01148 
01149         stripe_offset = le16_to_cpu(lum->lmm_stripe_offset);
01150         if (stripe_offset != LOV_OFFSET_DEFAULT) {
01151                 /* if offset is not within valid range [0, osts_size) */
01152                 if (stripe_offset >= d->lod_osts_size) {
01153                         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "stripe offset %u >= bitmap size %u\n",
01154                                stripe_offset, d->lod_osts_size);
01155                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01156                 }
01157 
01158                 /* if lmm_stripe_offset is *not* in bitmap */
01159                 if (!cfs_bitmap_check(d->lod_ost_bitmap, stripe_offset)) {
01160                         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "stripe offset %u not in bitmap\n",
01161                                stripe_offset);
01162                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01163                 }
01164         }
01165 
01166         if (magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1 || magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1_DEF)
01167                 lum_size = offsetof(struct lov_user_md_v1,
01168                                     lmm_objects[0]);
01169         else if (magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3 || magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3_DEF)
01170                 lum_size = offsetof(struct lov_user_md_v3,
01171                                     lmm_objects[0]);
01172         else
01173                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01174 
01175         stripe_count = le16_to_cpu(lum->lmm_stripe_count);
01176         if (buf->lb_len != lum_size) {
01177                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "invalid buf len %zu for lov_user_md with "
01178                        "magic %#x and stripe_count %u\n",
01179                        buf->lb_len, magic, stripe_count);
01180                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01181         }
01182 
01183         if (!(magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3 || magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3_DEF))
01184                 goto out;
01185 
01186         lum3 = buf->lb_buf;
01187         if (buf->lb_len < sizeof(*lum3)) {
01188                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "buf len %zu too small for lov_user_md_v3\n",
01189                        buf->lb_len);
01190                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01191         }
01192 
01193         /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
01194          * pool_hashkey_keycmp() */
01195         /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
01196         pool = lod_find_pool(d, lum3->lmm_pool_name);
01197         if (pool == NULL)
01198                 goto out;
01199 
01200         if (stripe_offset != LOV_OFFSET_DEFAULT) {
01201                 rc = lod_check_index_in_pool(stripe_offset, pool);
01202                 if (rc < 0)
01203                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01204         }
01205 
01206         if (is_from_disk && stripe_count > pool_tgt_count(pool)) {
01207                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL,
01208                        "stripe count %u > # OSTs %u in the pool\n",
01209                        stripe_count, pool_tgt_count(pool));
01210                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01211         }
01212 
01213 out:
01214         if (pool != NULL)
01215                 lod_pool_putref(pool);
01216 
01217         RETURN(rc);
01218 }
01219 
01220 void lod_fix_desc_stripe_size(__u64 *val)
01221 {
01222         if (*val < LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE) {
01223                 if (*val != 0)
01224                         LCONSOLE_INFO("Increasing default stripe size to "
01225                                       "minimum value %u\n",
01226                                       LOV_DESC_STRIPE_SIZE_DEFAULT);
01227                 *val = LOV_DESC_STRIPE_SIZE_DEFAULT;
01228         } else if (*val & (LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE - 1)) {
01229                 *val &= ~(LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE - 1);
01230                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Changing default stripe size to "LPU64" (a "
01231                               "multiple of %u)\n",
01232                               *val, LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE);
01233         }
01234 }
01235 
01236 void lod_fix_desc_stripe_count(__u32 *val)
01237 {
01238         if (*val == 0)
01239                 *val = 1;
01240 }
01241 
01242 void lod_fix_desc_pattern(__u32 *val)
01243 {
01244         /* from lov_setstripe */
01245         if ((*val != 0) && (*val != LOV_PATTERN_RAID0)) {
01246                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Unknown stripe pattern: %#x\n", *val);
01247                 *val = 0;
01248         }
01249 }
01250 
01251 void lod_fix_desc_qos_maxage(__u32 *val)
01252 {
01253         /* fix qos_maxage */
01254         if (*val == 0)
01255                 *val = LOV_DESC_QOS_MAXAGE_DEFAULT;
01256 }
01257 
01263 void lod_fix_desc(struct lov_desc *desc)
01264 {
01265         lod_fix_desc_stripe_size(&desc->ld_default_stripe_size);
01266         lod_fix_desc_stripe_count(&desc->ld_default_stripe_count);
01267         lod_fix_desc_pattern(&desc->ld_pattern);
01268         lod_fix_desc_qos_maxage(&desc->ld_qos_maxage);
01269 }
01270 
01280 int lod_pools_init(struct lod_device *lod, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01281 {
01282         struct obd_device          *obd;
01283         struct lov_desc            *desc;
01284         int                         rc;
01285         ENTRY;
01286 
01287         obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
01288         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
01289         obd->obd_lu_dev = &lod->lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
01290 
01291         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) < 1) {
01292                 CERROR("LOD setup requires a descriptor\n");
01293                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01294         }
01295 
01296         desc = (struct lov_desc *)lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
01297 
01298         if (sizeof(*desc) > LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1)) {
01299                 CERROR("descriptor size wrong: %d > %d\n",
01300                        (int)sizeof(*desc), LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1));
01301                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01302         }
01303 
01304         if (desc->ld_magic != LOV_DESC_MAGIC) {
01305                 if (desc->ld_magic == __swab32(LOV_DESC_MAGIC)) {
01306                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: Swabbing lov desc %p\n",
01307                                obd->obd_name, desc);
01308                         lustre_swab_lov_desc(desc);
01309                 } else {
01310                         CERROR("%s: Bad lov desc magic: %#x\n",
01311                                obd->obd_name, desc->ld_magic);
01312                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01313                 }
01314         }
01315 
01316         lod_fix_desc(desc);
01317 
01318         desc->ld_active_tgt_count = 0;
01319         lod->lod_desc = *desc;
01320 
01321         lod->lod_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_CLI;
01322 
01323         /* Set up allocation policy (QoS and RR) */
01324         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list);
01325         init_rwsem(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
01326         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
01327         lod->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
01328         lod->lod_qos.lq_reset = 1;
01329         /* Default priority is toward free space balance */
01330         lod->lod_qos.lq_prio_free = 232;
01331         /* Default threshold for rr (roughly 17%) */
01332         lod->lod_qos.lq_threshold_rr = 43;
01333 
01334         /* Set up OST pool environment */
01335         lod->lod_pools_hash_body = cfs_hash_create("POOLS", HASH_POOLS_CUR_BITS,
01336                                                    HASH_POOLS_MAX_BITS,
01337                                                    HASH_POOLS_BKT_BITS, 0,
01338                                                    CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
01339                                                    CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
01340                                                    &pool_hash_operations,
01341                                                    CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
01342         if (lod->lod_pools_hash_body == NULL)
01343                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01344 
01345         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lod->lod_pool_list);
01346         lod->lod_pool_count = 0;
01347         rc = lod_ost_pool_init(&lod->lod_pool_info, 0);
01348         if (rc)
01349                 GOTO(out_hash, rc);
01350         lod_qos_rr_init(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rr);
01351         rc = lod_ost_pool_init(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_pool, 0);
01352         if (rc)
01353                 GOTO(out_pool_info, rc);
01354 
01355         RETURN(0);
01356 
01357 out_pool_info:
01358         lod_ost_pool_free(&lod->lod_pool_info);
01359 out_hash:
01360         cfs_hash_putref(lod->lod_pools_hash_body);
01361 
01362         return rc;
01363 }
01364 
01372 int lod_pools_fini(struct lod_device *lod)
01373 {
01374         struct obd_device   *obd = lod2obd(lod);
01375         struct pool_desc    *pool, *tmp;
01376         ENTRY;
01377 
01378         list_for_each_entry_safe(pool, tmp, &lod->lod_pool_list, pool_list) {
01379                 /* free pool structs */
01380                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "delete pool %p\n", pool);
01381                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
01382                  * pool_hashkey_keycmp() */
01383                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
01384                 lod_pool_del(obd, pool->pool_name);
01385         }
01386 
01387         cfs_hash_putref(lod->lod_pools_hash_body);
01388         lod_ost_pool_free(&(lod->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_pool));
01389         lod_ost_pool_free(&lod->lod_pool_info);
01390 
01391         RETURN(0);
01392 }
